meanings.sent1: The factory owner proletarianizes the workers by paying low wages.
meanings.sent2: The industrial revolution proletarianizes many people who used to be farmers.
meanings.sent3: The magician's spell proletarianizes the wealthy prince into a commoner.
meanings.sent4: The economic downturn proletarianizes the once affluent neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The harsh reality of poverty proletarianizes families struggling to make ends meet.

meanings.definition: To cause to become part of the working class.
meanings.sent1: The new job opportunity proletarianizes individuals seeking better employment.
meanings.sent2: Moving to the city often proletarianizes rural migrants looking for work.
meanings.sent3: The lottery win unexpectedly proletarianizes the millionaire overnight.
meanings.sent4: The global recession proletarianizes many professionals who lose their jobs.
meanings.sent5: The company's downsizing plan proletarianizes a significant portion of its workforce.
